alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 7:58PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cherry and southeastern Sheridan Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 658 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Ashby to 7 miles northwest of Ellsworth. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ellsworth, Snow Lake, Watson Lake, Big Hill, Dipping Vat Meadow, Billys Lake, Wolf Hill, Finnegan Lake, Kennedy Lake and Argo Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 3 and 22. Highway 2 near mile marker 118. Highway 61 between mile markers 185 and 192. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
